member.name: T:JsonSpanParser.JArrayNode
member.summary: an internal object describing a json-array. Use JSpan for parsing

member.name: T:JsonSpanParser.JObjectNode
member.summary: an internal object describing a json-object. Use JSpan for parsing

member.name: T:JsonSpanParser.JSpan
member.summary: Allows to parse

member.name: P:JsonSpanParser.JSpan.IsEmpty
member.summary: false if Source(jsonCharSpan) is empty, otherwise true

member.name: P:JsonSpanParser.JSpan.IsArray
member.summary: true if JSpan includes json array, otherwise false. you can get the value by index

member.name: P:JsonSpanParser.JSpan.IsObject
member.summary: true if JSpan includes json object, otherwise false. you can get the value by key

member.name: P:JsonSpanParser.JSpan.IsValue
member.summary: true if JSpan includes any value, otherwise false. you can get the value by ToString method

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.JSpan.Parse(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},JsonSpanParser.IMemoryContext)
member.summary: Use to parse
member.param: span incudes json object as json-string
member.returns: an object similar in functionality to a JObject from Newtonsoft.Json.Linq
member.exception: throws if jsonCharSpan include wrong json

member.name: P:JsonSpanParser.JSpan.Item(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: if JSpan is json object use this method to get value by key, if JSpan not an json object, then the method will return an empty JSpan
member.returns: value or empty JSpan if the key is not found

member.name: P:JsonSpanParser.JSpan.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: if JSpan is json array use this method to get value by index, if JSpan not an json array, then the method will return an empty JSpan
member.returns: value or empty JSpan if the key is not found

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.JSpan.GetEnumerator
member.summary: allows you to get an enumerator of the array contained in the JSpan
member.returns: by default if JSpan does not contain an array

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.JSpan.ToString
member.summary: use to get the value contained in the JSpan

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.JSpan.AsJsonString
member.summary: use to get the value contained in the JSpan in json form (with opening and closing elements defining the json object)

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.JSpan.Deserialize``1
member.summary: use to deserialize
member.typeparam: the type to which the JSpan(json object) will be deserialized

member.name: T:JsonSpanParser.JSpanEnumerator
member.summary: an object that provides access to a json-array, similar to an IEnumerator

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.JSpanEnumerator.MoveNext
member.summary: assigns the Ð¡urrent to the next element of the enumerator
member.returns: true, if there are objects in the enumerator

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.JSpanEnumerator.MovePrevious
member.summary: similar to MoveNext, allows you to iterate over objects from the last to the first
member.returns: true, if there are objects in the enumerator

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.JSpanEnumerator.Last
member.summary: allows you to get the last element of the enumeration

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.JSpanEnumerator.First
member.summary: allows you to get the first element of the enumeration

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.JSpanEnumerator.Count
member.summary: allows you to get the length of the enumeration

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.JSpanEnumerator.ResetToFirst
member.summary: moves the iterator to the first item.

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.JSpanEnumerator.ResetToLast
member.summary: moves the iterator to the last item. Use before using the MovePrevious

member.name: P:JsonSpanParser.JSpanEnumerator.Current
member.summary: contains the current enumeration object or default of JSpan

member.name: T:JsonSpanParser.MemoryContext
member.summary: basic IMemoryContext implementation

member.name: P:JsonSpanParser.MemoryContext.ObjectRefMemory
member.summary: memory access for storing objects

member.name: P:JsonSpanParser.MemoryContext.ArrayRefMemory
member.summary: memory access for storing objects

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.MemoryContext.Release
member.summary: in this implementation allows you to overwrite memory without utilizing it and not allocating new

member.name: T:JsonSpanParser.IMemoryHolder`1
member.summary: implements the necessary memory access
member.typeparam: the type to be located in memory is used in IMemoryContext

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.IMemoryHolder`1.GetByRef(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to get an object from memory by reference
member.exception: When indx less then zero or bigger then length

member.name: M:JsonSpanParser.IMemoryHolder`1.Add(`0)
member.summary: Allows to write an object into memory and get a reference to it

member.name: T:JsonSpanParser.IMemoryContext
member.summary: implement at your discretion to provide unmanaged memory for the parser to run without allocations, or use ready-made MemoryContext class

member.name: P:JsonSpanParser.IMemoryContext.ObjectRefMemory
member.summary: implements the necessary memory access for storing objects

member.name: P:JsonSpanParser.IMemoryContext.ArrayRefMemory
member.summary: implements the necessary memory access for storing objects
